_comment: This is an example of DP-GEN on Slurm
Last updated on 2021.4.30 for DP-GEN 0.9.2 by Yuzhi Zhang

train._comment: Specify the installed path of DeePMD-kit
The version of DeePMD-kit should be 1.*

machine._comment: Supported batches include slurm, pbs, shell, lsf.
If your jobs are executed on a local workstation, you can let hostname be localhost.
Otherwise you should provide the IP of machine you want to connect via ssh.
The port for connection, most common settings is 22
Specify your username. Sometimes you may need specify password. Exactly the name of key is password.
Specify where you want your job executes, all of tasks will be sent to work_path on this machine.
You should alwasy make sure that directory of work_path exits.

resources._comment: The number of nodes. This will generate #SBATCH -N 1 in your script.
Environment to be activated. This will generate source PATH/train_new.env .
Module is a common tools on HPC clustes to manage softwares for multiple users.
Modules to be loaded. This will generate module load intel

model_devi._comment: DP-GEN will put 5 tasks together in one submitting script.

resources._comment: If you set with_mpi to true, the defaulted parallelling command of Slurm, srun, will be appended as prefix.
If you do not want this, you can set with_mpi to false, and specify parallelling command yourself.
Notice that in json format, the upper/lower case is strict. You should write true instead of True and false instead of False
